alert.note: Alert for Northern Sangre de Cristo Mountains Between 8500 And 11000 Ft; Southern Sangre De Cristo Mountains Between 7500 and 11000 Ft; Walsenburg Vicinity, Upper Huerfano River Basin Below 7500 Ft (Colorado) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 11 at 5:20PM MDT by NWS Pueblo
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of south central Huerfano County through 600 PM MDT... At 516 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near La Veta, or near Spring Burn Scar south of Highway 160 in Huerfano county, moving northeast at 15 mph. A Flash Flood Warning remains in effect for portions of The Spring Creek burn scar. HAZARD...Wind gusts of 50 to 55 mph and nickel size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Spring Burn Scar south of Highway 160 in Huerfano county, Indian Creek on the southeastern Spring Burn Scar, eastern Spring Burn Scar north of Highway 160 and La Veta. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.88 IN MAX WIND GUST...55 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
